sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Holdings (DFLI) Price Target Increased by 900.00% to 17.85
feed.summary: The average one-year price target for Dragonfly Energy Holdings (DFLI) has been significantly increased by 900.00% to $17.85 per share, up from $1.78. This new target represents a 342.93% increase from the last closing price of $4.03. Institutional ownership has also surged, with the total shares owned by institutions increasing by 466.44% in the last three months, indicating a bullish outlook.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy completes one-for-ten reverse stock split on Nasdaq
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (NASDAQ:DFLI) completed a one-for-ten reverse stock split effective Thursday to maintain Nasdaq listing compliance, reducing outstanding shares from approximately 120.8 million to 12.1 million. This move follows a period of significant stock volatility and is part of broader efforts to innovate and expand product offerings, including partnerships and new product launches in lithium batteries and portable power stations.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy announces 1-for-10 reverse stock split
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Corporation has announced a 1-for-10 reverse stock split of its common stock, effective at 5:00 PM Eastern Time on December 18, 2024. This action is intended to increase the per-share trading price to meet NASDAQ continued listing requirements. The company's Class A common stock will begin trading on a split-adjusted basis under a new CUSIP number on December 19, 2024.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy shares slide after reverse stock split plan revealed
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy shares tumbled after the company disclosed plans for a reverse stock split. The company is seeking shareholder approval for a split ratio between 1-for-2 and 1-for-20. This move is intended to boost the stock price and help the company satisfy Nasdaq listing requirements, as its shares have fallen more than 75% year to date.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy stock tumbles after 1-for-10 reverse split announcement
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp (NASDAQ:DFLI) stock dropped significantly after announcing a 1-for-10 reverse stock split to regain Nasdaq compliance. The split, effective December 18, 2025, will reduce outstanding shares and is described by CEO Dr. Denis Phares as a technical step to strengthen the balance sheet and improve liquidity. Stockholders approved the board's authority for a reverse split in October, with the 1-for-10 ratio decided in December.

feed.title: Why Did Dragonfly Energy Shares Plunge 44% Today?
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (DFLI) shares plunged over 44% in premarket trading after the company announced a 1-for-10 reverse stock split, which will reduce its outstanding shares to approximately 12.1 million. The battery technology company's shareholders had approved the reverse split earlier. Despite the stock plunge, retail sentiment on Stocktwits remained bullish, with users noting the stock appears oversold.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy to implement 1-for-10 reverse stock split
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (Nasdaq:DFLI) announced a 1-for-10 reverse stock split, effective December 18, 2025, to maintain Nasdaq compliance. Despite a 78% fall over the past year, the company's stock has seen a 223% return in the last six months. This move will reduce outstanding shares from 120.8 million to 12.1 million without altering authorized shares or par value.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy (Nasdaq: DFLI) enacts 1-for-10 reverse split, shrinks share count
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy (Nasdaq: DFLI) announced a 1-for-10 reverse stock split effective December 18, 2025, reducing its outstanding shares from approximately 120.8 million to 12.1 million. This action is primarily a technical step to maintain Nasdaq compliance. The company will continue trading under the DFLI ticker with a new CUSIP, and all fractional shares will be paid in cash.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy debuts industrial-grade power stations
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. has launched its Battle Born Power Station Series, an all-in-one line of portable power stations for professional and off-grid use. The series includes the 3000 and Pro 5000 models, offering 3,000 and 5,000 watts of continuous output respectively, powered by advanced LiFePO batteries. These industrial-grade systems are designed for durability in harsh environments and are assembled in North America.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy in Partnership with National Railway Supply
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. has announced a new distribution partnership with National Railway Supply (NRS), enabling NRS to offer Dragonfly Energy's Battle Born Batteries, including their lithium battery line, to the North American rail sector. This partnership follows the American Railway Engineering and Maintenance-of-Way Association (AREMA) officially passing its first lithium battery Manual Part, a development in which Dragonfly Energy played a significant role. The collaboration aims to modernize rail power systems with advanced LiFePO₄ technology, offering safer, more efficient, and lower-maintenance solutions.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy (DFLI) Stock Jumps on New Rail and Marine Deals: Latest Price, News, and 2026 Forecast
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy (DFLI) shares jumped 8.3% on new commercial deals in rail, marine, and trucking, coupled with a significant balance sheet restructuring that reduced debt and improved financial flexibility. Despite ongoing losses, Q3 2025 showed strong OEM growth and improved margins, and analysts forecast considerable upside with price targets between $1.50–$2.25, framing 2025-2026 as transition years towards a more sustainable business.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Partners with NRS, AREMA Approves First Lithium Battery Standard
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. has announced a distribution partnership with National Railway Supply LLC (NRS), making NRS the first to offer a lithium battery line following AREMA's approval of its first lithium battery Manual Part. This collaboration allows NRS to distribute Dragonfly Energy's Battle Born Batteries nationwide, providing advanced energy storage solutions aligned with the new AREMA standard for rail applications. The partnership aims to modernize rail backup systems by offering safer, lower-maintenance lithium iron phosphate technology over traditional lead-acid and nickel cadmium options.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy (DFLI) Stock: Powers Up Rail Industry with National Railway Supply Partnership
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy (DFLI) has entered a distribution partnership with National Railway Supply (NRS) to introduce its lithium battery line to the North American rail sector. This collaboration coincides with the American Railway Engineering and Maintenance-of-Way Association (AREMA) approving its first lithium battery standard, paving the way for wider adoption of Dragonfly's LiFePO₄ technology in rail signaling systems. The partnership positions Dragonfly Energy as a key player in modernizing the rail industry's energy solutions.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy partners with NRS to bring lithium batteries to rail sector
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. has partnered with National Railway Supply LLC to introduce lithium batteries to the North American rail industry, following the American Railway Engineering and Maintenance-of-Way Association's approval of its first lithium battery standard. This collaboration aims to replace traditional lead-acid and nickel-cadmium batteries with more efficient and environmentally friendly lithium iron phosphate technology, leveraging Dragonfly Energy's Battle Born Batteries and NRS's distribution network. Despite the market opportunity, Dragonfly Energy faces financial challenges with negative EBITDA and free cash flow.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy, NRS team up as AREMA okays first lithium rail standard
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy (Nasdaq: DFLI) has partnered with National Railway Supply (NRS) to distribute its Battle Born lithium batteries, marking NRS's first lithium battery offering for North American rail customers. This coincides with the American Railway Engineering and Maintenance-of-Way Association (AREMA) approving its first lithium battery standard, "Recommended Instructions for Lithium Batteries in Railroad Applications (09.06.02)," a development Dragonfly Energy contributed to over several years. The partnership and new standard are expected to accelerate the adoption of LiFePO₄ technology in critical rail applications, replacing older lead-acid and nickel-cadmium systems.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Expands Collaboration with World Cat, Integrating Battle Born Batteries into New 400DC-X Island Model
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. announced that World Cat is integrating Battle Born power systems into its new 400DC-X Island model, expanding on their successful use in the World Cat 325 DC. This collaboration strengthens Dragonfly Energy's presence in the marine OEM market and highlights the growing demand for their reliable and long-lasting lithium power solutions. The 400DC-X Island model will feature a 540Ah lithium power system and a dedicated AC inverter to meet customer demand for enhanced onboard capabilities.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Expands Marine OEM Footprint with World’s Largest Power Catamaran Manufacturer, World Cat
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. has announced an expanded partnership with World Cat, the largest power catamaran manufacturer, to integrate its Battle Born Batteries across more models. Following successful deployment in the World Cat 325 DC, Battle Born Batteries are now standard equipment for the new 400DC-X Island dual-console model, enhancing comfort features with a 540Ah lithium power system. This collaboration strengthens Dragonfly Energy's presence in the marine OEM market, highlighting the growing demand for reliable lithium power solutions.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Expands Marine Footprint with World Cat
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (Nasdaq: DFLI) announced that World Cat, the largest producer of power catamarans, has expanded its integration of Battle Born power systems across its new models, including the new 400DC-X Island. This expansion follows the successful deployment and strong performance of Dragonfly Energy's system on the World Cat 325 DC. The move strengthens Dragonfly Energy's position in the marine OEM market and highlights the growing demand for reliable lithium power solutions.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy (Nasdaq: DFLI) expands World Cat 400DC-X deal with 540Ah lithium system
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy (Nasdaq: DFLI) announced that World Cat has expanded the integration of Battle Born batteries as standard equipment on its new 400DC-X Island model, following successful multi-season use on the 325 DC. The 400DC-X Island will feature a 540Ah lithium ship's power system with a dedicated AC inverter, supporting various onboard amenities. This expansion reinforces Dragonfly Energy’s marine OEM footprint and product reliability in offshore environments and signifies a significant milestone for their marine OEM efforts.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Expands Marine OEM Footprint with World’s Largest Power Catamaran Manufacturer, World Cat
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. announced that World Cat, the world’s largest producer of power catamarans, has expanded its integration of Battle Born power systems across new models. Following successful deployment on the World Cat 325 DC, World Cat selected Battle Born Batteries as standard equipment for its new 400DC-X Island dual-console model, highlighting the proven performance and reliability of Dragonfly Energy's lithium power systems in marine applications. This expansion strengthens Dragonfly Energy’s presence in the marine OEM market.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Holdings (DFLI) Price Target Increased by 50.00% to 1.78
feed.summary: The average one-year price target for Dragonfly Energy Holdings (DFLI) has been increased by 50.00% to $1.78 per share, up from the prior estimate of $1.19. This new target represents a 122.04% increase from the latest reported closing price of $0.80 per share. Fund sentiment is bullish, with institutional ownership increasing significantly over the last quarter.

feed.title: Market Cool On Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp.'s (NASDAQ:DFLI) Revenues Pushing Shares 30% Lower
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp.'s shares have dropped 30% in the last 30 days, contributing to a 78% decline over the past year. Despite this, its P/S ratio of 1.8x is in line with the Electrical industry average in the U.S. While the company saw an 18% revenue gain last year, it experienced a 33% drop over the last three years, though analysts forecast a 29% annual revenue climb for the next three years, outpacing the industry.

feed.title: Market Cool On Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp.'s (NASDAQ:DFLI) Revenues Pushing Shares 30% Lower
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (NASDAQ:DFLI) shares have fallen 30% in the past month, contributing to a 78% decline over the last year. Despite the drop, its P/S ratio of 1.8x is in line with the Electrical industry, suggesting investors are indifferent. While future revenue growth is projected to be strong at 29% annually, outperforming the industry, the P/S ratio remains moderate, indicating skepticism among some shareholders regarding these forecasts.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Introduces Battle Born® Industrial-Grade Power Stations
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (Nasdaq: DFLI) has launched its new Battle Born® Power Station Series, featuring industrial-grade portable power stations designed for professional and off-grid applications. The series includes the Power Station 3000 and Power Station Pro 5000, offering reliable, emissions-free power in demanding environments, with pre-orders currently available and initial shipments expected in Q1 2026. These products provide a durable, long-term alternative to traditional fuel-powered generators.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy to Supply Battle Born DualFlow Power Pack
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. announced that Werner Enterprises, Inc. has placed an initial order for its Battle Born DualFlow Power Pack, an advanced lithium-powered auxiliary system designed to reduce engine idling. This order follows a successful real-world trial and marks a significant expansion for Dragonfly Energy into the heavy-duty trucking industry, validating the efficiency and reliability of its LiFePO₄-powered solutions for fleet operations. The system aims to lower fuel costs, reduce emissions, and improve driver comfort by providing power for hotel loads without running the main engine.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp: Strengthened Financials and Growth Prospects Drive Buy Rating
feed.summary: Canaccord Genuity analyst George Gianarikas has reiterated a Buy rating on Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp, increasing the price target to $2.25, citing the company's strengthened financial position and growth prospects. Recent transformative financings and better-than-expected Q3 2025 results for revenue and gross profit have improved financial stability and cash reserves, supporting long-term goals in battery manufacturing and solid-state energy storage. Roth MKM also maintained a Buy rating with a $1.50 price target.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy (Nasdaq: DFLI) wins Werner order for DualFlow Power Pack
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy (Nasdaq: DFLI) announced that Werner Enterprises (Nasdaq: WERN) has placed its first order for Battle Born® DualFlow Power Pack systems after a long-term pilot program. These lithium iron phosphate (LiFePO4) systems provide idle-reduction power for heavy-duty trucks, aiming to cut fuel consumption, emissions, and improve driver comfort and fleet efficiency. This order marks a significant commercial milestone for Dragonfly Energy's expansion into the heavy-duty trucking market.

feed.title: Canaccord Genuity raises Dragonfly Energy stock price target to $2.25 from $1.00
feed.summary: Canaccord Genuity has increased its price target for Dragonfly Energy Corp. (NASDAQ:DFLI) to $2.25 from $1.00, maintaining a Buy rating. This upgrade is driven by a stronger balance sheet and revised dilution estimates following successful capital raising, projecting a 178% upside from the current price despite recent stock performance. Dragonfly Energy also reported a 26% year-over-year sales increase in Q3 2025, reaching $16 million, demonstrating growth potential amidst financial challenges.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (NASDAQ:DFLI) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (NASDAQ: DFLI) held its Q3 2025 earnings call, reporting a 26% year-over-year revenue growth to $16 million and a significant improvement in adjusted EBITDA to negative $2.1 million. The company successfully completed a capital raising and debt restructuring, improving its balance sheet and liquidity, and is focusing on growth initiatives in OEM partnerships, heavy-duty trucking, and technology advancements. Despite macroeconomic challenges and a cautious Q4 outlook, management expressed confidence in achieving profitability in 2026 by expanding into new segments and leveraging a stronger financial foundation.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy (NASDAQ: DFLI) Q3 net sales $16.0M; margin 29.7%, exceeding guidance
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy (NASDAQ: DFLI) reported Q3 2025 net sales of $15.97M, a 25.5% increase year-over-year, and OEM sales growth of 44.3%. The company also saw its gross margin expand to 29.7% and improved its Adjusted EBITDA to $(2.1)M. Recent financial actions include raising $90M through public offerings and a significant debt restructuring, with Q4 2025 guidance set at approximately $13.0M in net sales and Adjusted EBITDA of $(3.3)M.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Announces Public Offering and Debt Restructuring - The Globe and Mail
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp announced a public offering and debt restructuring on October 16, 2025, according to a TipRanks report. The company faces significant financial challenges due to ongoing losses and high leverage, despite positive developments in revenue growth and strategic partnerships. Spark, TipRanks' AI tool, highlighted the financial instability and valuation concerns impacting the stock's overall score.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy's Stock Plunges Amidst Share Offerings and Dilution Fears, Not Acquisition - FinancialContent
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (NASDAQ: DFLI) has experienced a significant stock decline in October 2025, driven by multiple public offerings of common stock and pre-funded warrants, not an acquisition. These offerings, priced at a discount to market value, have caused severe share dilution and raised concerns about the company's financial stability. Existing shareholders are the primary "losers" due to diluted holdings, while institutional investors participating in the discounted offerings are the "winners," positioning themselves for potential profit.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Announces Public Offering and Debt Restructuring - TipRanks
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp announced a public offering of 36 million shares and pre-funded warrants, aiming to raise approximately $51.7 million for working capital, debt repayment, and battery technology investments. Concurrently, the company reached a non-binding agreement to restructure its debt, including a $45 million prepayment and conversion of $25 million into preferred stock, to improve financial stability and support growth. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates DFLI as Neutral due to financial challenges despite some positive developments.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. Announces Pricing of $55.4 Million Public Offering of Common Stock and Pre-Funded Warrants - Quiver Quantitative
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. announced the pricing of a public offering of common stock and pre-funded warrants, aiming to raise approximately $55.4 million. The proceeds will be used for working capital, prepaying $45 million of debt, and investing in next-generation battery technologies. The offering is expected to close on October 17, 2025, with Canaccord Genuity acting as the sole bookrunner.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy stock falls after pricing $55.4 million public offering By Investing.com - Investing.com Canada
feed.summary: This article reports that Dragonfly Energy's stock fell after the company priced a $55.4 million public offering. However, due to a client-side exception, the full content of the article is unavailable.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy stock falls after pricing $55.4 million public offering - Investing.com India
feed.summary: The article indicates Dragonfly Energy's stock fell after pricing a $55.4 million public offering. However, due to an application error, the full article content is not available.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy stock falls after pricing $55.4 million public offering - Investing.com
feed.summary: This article reports that Dragonfly Energy's stock fell after the company announced the pricing of a $55.4 million public offering. The content, however, appears to be an error message, suggesting that the actual article could not be loaded.

feed.title: $55.4M Offering: Dragonfly Energy Prices 36M Shares & 5M Pre-Funded Warrants; Closing Oct 17, 2025 - Stock Titan
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy (Nasdaq: DFLI) announced the pricing of a public offering totaling approximately $55.4 million, including 36,000,000 common shares and up to 5,000,000 pre-funded warrants. The offering is expected to close around October 17, 2025, with net proceeds designated for working capital, prepayment of $45 million in term loan indebtedness, and investments in new battery technologies. This move aims to strengthen the company's financial position and advance its dry electrode and solid-state battery initiatives despite potential share dilution.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Raises Cash, But Shares Tumble After Offering
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy announced a new share offering to raise $55 million, causing its stock to fall 22% due to shareholder dilution. The funds will primarily pay off $45 million in debt, with the remainder allocated to working capital and next-generation battery research. This move highlights the company's strategy to strengthen its balance sheet and push innovation in the competitive energy storage sector, despite short-term stock market volatility.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy announces proposed public offering of common stock - TradingView
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp announced a proposed public offering of common stock and pre-funded warrants. The company plans to use the proceeds from this offering for a $45 million debt prepayment.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Holdings - stockholders approve increase by 9 million shares under 2022 plan - SEC filing - MarketScreener
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings stockholders have approved an increase of 9 million shares under the company's 2022 plan, as detailed in a recent SEC filing. This decision comes amidst other recent news for the company, including a proposed public offering and patent allowance for their wireless battery communications technology. The company's stock, trading under DFLI, has seen recent fluctuations and has an average target price significantly below its last close.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Holdings - Stockholders Approve Increase By 9 Million Shares Under 2022 Plan - SEC Filing - TradingView
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. stockholders have approved an increase of 9 million shares under the company's 2022 plan. This information comes from a recent SEC filing. The company's stock symbol is DFLI.

feed.title: $45M Prepayment Planned — Dragonfly Energy Commences Proposed Offering, Grants 15% Underwriter Option - Stock Titan
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy (Nasdaq: DFLI) announced a proposed underwritten public offering of common stock and pre-funded warrants, aiming to raise capital for working capital, to prepay $45 million in term loan debt, and to invest in revenue-driving initiatives and battery technology. Canaccord Genuity is the sole bookrunner, and the offering includes a 30-day underwriter option to purchase an additional 15% of the securities. The completion and terms of the offering are subject to market conditions.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy Approves Key Proposals at Annual Meeting - TipRanks
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp (DFLI) announced that its stockholders approved several key proposals at the Annual Meeting, including an increase in shares for the 2022 Equity Incentive Plan and the election of two Class C directors. A reverse stock split proposal was also approved, while proposals to increase authorized shares and adjust voting standards did not pass. The company's financial outlook, as evaluated by Spark, TipRanks’ AI Analyst, is Neutral due to ongoing losses and high leverage, despite positive revenue growth and strategic partnerships.

feed.title: What's Going On With Dragonfly Energy Shares Wednesday? - Benzinga
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (DFLI) shares are trading higher after the company announced the issuance of a Notice of Allowance from the USPTO for its Dragonfly IntelLigence battery communication technology. This new patent covers technology enabling multiple battery systems and wireless devices to communicate over a connected mesh network, allowing key operating data and warning codes to be shared efficiently. The company expects this to strengthen its IntelLigence platform and advance American battery technology.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy To Receive US Patent for Battery Communication Tech - RV PRO
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy is set to receive a US patent for its battery communication technology, enhancing system awareness, reliability, and coordination across connected energy systems. The patent covers the use of multiple battery systems and wireless devices that share information over a mesh network, even if one battery is powered down. This development strengthens Dragonfly Energy's IntelLigence platform and supports its commitment to advancing American battery technology and manufacturing.

feed.title: Why Is Dragonfly Energy Stock Soaring Wednesday? - Dragonfly Energy Hldgs (NASDAQ:DFLI) - Benzinga
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp. (NASDAQ: DFLI) shares surged after the company announced a patent win for its connected battery technology and reported preliminary third-quarter 2025 results that exceeded guidance with a 26% increase in net sales. The patent strengthens its Dragonfly IntelLigence platform, enabling multiple battery systems and connected devices to share performance data wirelessly, enhancing reliability and coordination. The company’s Q3 2025 net sales reached $16 million, and adjusted EBITDA loss improved by approximately $3.3 million year-over-year.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy stock soars after patent approval for battery tech By Investing.com - Investing.com Nigeria
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp (NASDAQ:DFLI) stock rose 35% in premarket trading after receiving patent approval for its battery communication technology from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office. The new patent covers multiple battery systems and wireless devices that share information over a connected mesh network, enhancing their IntelLigence platform. This advancement allows batteries to communicate directly and improves system awareness and coordination.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy stock soars after patent approval for battery tech By Investing.com - Investing.com UK
feed.summary: Dragonfly Energy Holdings Corp (NASDAQ:DFLI) stock soared 35% in premarket trading after receiving patent approval for its battery communication technology. The patent strengthens their IntelLigence platform by enabling batteries to communicate directly through their Battle Born HUB product, enhancing system awareness and coordination. This approval contributes to Dragonfly Energy's growing intellectual property portfolio in cell manufacturing, battery pack design, and system intelligence.

feed.title: Dragonfly Energy stock soars after patent approval for battery tech By Investing.com - Investing.com UK
feed.summary: This article indicates an application error preventing the content from loading on the Investing.com UK website.
